ygData.subject: Re: Plus mana items versus Plus Int and Wisdom
ygData.msgSnippet: I do believe the only time you get the bump to int or mana, etc is when you have the item on or holding it in cases of other items you don t actually wear...
ygData.messageBody:
I do believe the only time you get the bump to int or mana, etc is when you
have the item on or holding it in cases of other items you don't actually
wear... at a loss for what those are exactly by name, but they are out
there...you get plus 30 mana when putting on "x" item, it only goes to
reason you lose the mana bump when you take "x" off again...gotta pick and
choose which things are worthwhile to wear... Otherwise everyone would be
trading and then the casting classes would have unlimited mana at their
disposal.

>Don Bickner wrote:
>
> Hello everyone, Can anyone tell me the difference between a +mana item
>versus a +int and wis item. I have a chance to buy the Savants cap for
about
>30 plat and am wondering why it could be worth that much since I could just
>a + mana ring for a whole lot less. Also in wearing the cap I would have to
>give up on my Halo of light. Thanks Kueken, Mith Marr
>
>A plus mana item will add the specified amount of mana to your mana pool.
>A plus intelligence item will effect your mana indirectly. A good rule of
>thumb is that for every extra 5 points of intelligence you will add 1 point
>of mana per level
